data.title: "whole word" search in editor will not find word at end of line
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Home
Godot v2.1.1.stable.official


**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When doing a find or search/replace, if the **Whole Word** checkbox is checked, the search pattern will not be found at the end of a line.

**Steps to reproduce:**
In editor:

    func foo(args):
        var ret = ""
        for arg in args:
            if typeof(arg) == TYPE_STRING:
                ret += arg
        return ret

Search for **`ret`** with **Whole Words** checked.  The editor will highlight **`ret`** in the lines `var `**`ret`**` = null` and **`ret`**` = arg`, but will not find it in `return ret`.

data.title: .ogg sample support
data.body: So the game im working on i have most of the sounds as .ogg files, and they arent too too long, but i'd like to keep the smaller file size when using them, would it be possible to add support in sample players for .ogg files?

data.title: Comment section for official Godot api, tutorial and other part website?
data.body:
I don't know if this is the right place but... I find the comment section beneath PHP api/documentation very useful. Can there be something equal for Godot documentation where people can make comments, reply, upvote, downvote comments about specific api, tutorials that's on the official website.

Sorry if this is not the right place, but I think this is the only way to get attention of Godoy developers.

data.title: File System panel hierarchy displays incorrectly after rename/move.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Windows 10
Godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I rename/move a script to a folder and afterwards the file system panel is displaying the wrong hierarchy. I noticed this also happens after importing a scene. There is probably the same problem going on in many places.

I expect the hierarchy to be displayed correctly. I'd also expect there to be a refresh button for the panel if resources are added externally.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Rename/move an object in the file system to a sub folder.

data.title: GDScript - The dictionary from get_signal_connection_list() doesn't parse .signal
data.body:
This is on Windows version 2.1.1

When you try to access the dictionary result of this method, you can't use the dot notation for signal.  The editor can't see to parse it.

```
func _ready():
	connect("exit_tree", self, "test")
	for s in get_signal_connection_list("exit_tree"):
		print(s.signal)

```
![godot_2016-12-17_18-27-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13004169/21288249/8349e498-c486-11e6-8a93-d2ab0d8bf105.png)

data.title: Directory - A way to get_next() without getting . or ..
data.body:
Every single time I work with directory, I never want to use . or .. that appears during get_next(). 
If there was a way to disable it all-together, we would save time and work. :)

Would anyone mind adding a Directory function that allows us to enable/disable . .. from appearing during get_next()?

Ex.:
```
var dir = Directory.new()
dir.ignore_dots(true)
```

data.title: Option to change the default PascalCase/CamelCase into snake_case when adding Nodes
data.body:
I am blown away that I can't find an existing issue about this. 
Most people that I know, uses snake_case in all their Godot projects. 
I don't see why we couldn't implement an option to change the PascalCase into snake_case when adding them to the scene :)

data.title: add the ability to change FPS of animated sprite from GDScript
I have to press enter to change the value, even though the editor shows the value I entered at all times
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
current master branch commit id: afbe013ba12d68f20ef1dfe2d7a895105a440bd9

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I was trying to change the FPS of an animated script and when I typed in 10 instead of 5 and hit play it didn't change anything. I later understood it's because I never pressed Enter after changing the value. Now I believe if there is no save button some where that I can press then I expect my setting to be applied right after I type in the value. Having to press Enter wasn't really obvious to me, I thought it was a bug and kept trying to fix it. especially that the value I entered **does not change back** when I leave the screen or click away or play the game or whatever.

So what do you guys think?
**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to change the value of any property without pressing enter.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Implements documents for modules
data.body:
Editor can generate class documentations for modules in thier own xml files.
* To extract document xml of a module with `-doctool`
```
$ ./bin/godot.x11.tools.64 -doctool ./modules/editor_server/classes.xml ./doc/base/classes.xml ./modules/rawpacker/classes.x
ml
```
This command generates class documents in `modules/editor_server/classes.xml` of the module `editor_server` which is all classes exported from C++ except classes defined in `doc/base/classes.xml` and `modules/rawpacker/classes.xml`
* The xml should be put in your module folder and name with `classes.xml`
* Fill the content of the generated xml file
* Rebuild your editor
* Your module documentation works!

(*Bugsquad edit*) Fixes #4562

data.title: Saving paths in binary when importing font
data.body:
Was discussing the problem on IRC and was advised to create an issue here about this.

Some paths to the original files are saved in the binary when importing a font, causing  problems when sharing the project with the rest of our team. Check out the link below for more details.

Original post https://godotdevelopers.org/forum/discussion/18094/what-is-the-correct-way-to-import-a-bitmap-font-we-get-load-errors#latest

data.title: Distinguish between 2d and 3d scenes
data.body: Currently, Godot uses the same format to store 3d scenes, making 2d scenes much larger than required, just because Node2D derivatives still have the 3D properties available but set to null. If they are separated, it could cut down on file size, and it wouldn't make much of an impact because very few people actually use 2D in 3D (or vice versa), except in techdemos. Another thing that could be done is engine.cfg could contain whether the project is for 2D or 3D, making them distinguishable in the project list.

data.title: Fix typo in French translation.

Added the option to set hide on item selection. Usable in GDScript and from within the source code when you want to specify popup menus you don't want to close immediately when selecting an item.

_(Sorry about Git, still learning and messing up..!)_

data.title: Can't Add Script if Script Exists!!
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1, Windows 8.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If you make a script on a node, save the script, then delete the node, and then make a new scene, add a node, and then add script, and select the path of the script you had saved, it says invalid path, file already exists, when obviously it should just add the script you want.  

I.E. It seems like you can't add a pre-existing script to a node.  'Add Script' should be changed to say 'Create New Script and Attach' or it should allow you to add a pre-existing script.

**Steps to reproduce:**

data.title: GDScript: writing only "array[i]" doesn't trigger an error
data.body:
Tested on my Godot fork (last update 4d8bed33215c005f6aa6fcb34d5d343ee3bee23e)
Windows 10 64 bits

I wrote this in GDScript:
```
	for i in range(0, index):
		pts[j]
		j += 1
```
I forgot to assign a value to `pts[j]` or do anything with it. However, it didn't trigger any error, the code probably did nothing at all. It took me some time to find this, it would be nice for Godot to indicate this as an error.

data.title: Rigidbody2D objects appear with wrong coords
data.body:
**Issue description**:
I've been experiencing this issue since Godot 2.1. Rigidbody2D objects sometimes just spawn in a distance of their actual coords. Also I've noticed that the distance depends on physics_fps value. With high physics fps the distance between a Rigidbody2D appearing on a scene and it's actual coords is larger.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I tried to reproduce it myself, but the bug appears rarely. I've usually spotted it only with physics_fps value set to 200 and Rigidbody2Ds' gravity scale set to 10.

**Godot version:** Linux x86_64, Godot 2.1.1 stable

data.title: Mac (Fat format) export from Windows crashes (error -10825) on startup in Mac
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
exported from win7x64 godot 2.1.1
trying to launch via itch.io app on Mac OS X 10.10.5

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
On launch, an error popup says exit code 1.  In a log file this is the error detail the user gets:
![mac-probs2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16719964/21179983/f94794e8-c1f6-11e6-8fbd-f123efb8f74f.png)

Now, I'm aware the execute bit is still not set properly by godot ( #527 ), but [the itch.io app's documentation says that it is supposed to set this automatically when uploading with butler](https://itch.io/docs/itch/integrating/platforms/macos.html), which is what I used.  As you can see from the debug output it found the .app within the .zip OK.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Use the itch.io app (you can download from http://itch.io/app ) on Mac and try to install and launch the game https://ibwwg.itch.io/52cp2k from within the itch app.  You should get an error like this:

![mac-probs1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16719964/21180090/a7664628-c1f7-11e6-9879-a0dd1f7f5fc3.png)

I'm assuming this is a Godot problem, since the same procedure on Linux and Windows results in a running game.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

https://github.com/IBwWG/52cp2k

data.title: Adding "export (Array, Type) var my_vars" to GDScript for arrays with pre-selected type.
data.body:
We know that using a line such as
`export (Texture) var my_texture`
in GDscript will allow you to select one individual image from the Editor.
![](http://i.imgur.com/cYaOrbW.png)

That is nice, but what if you wanted to load 5 or 10 images. You would have to copy paste 5-10 lines of code in GDScript, as well as keep track of var names of each texture, my_texture1, my_texture2 and so on. ![](http://i.imgur.com/spb5b0q.png)

Here is my idea of future implementation:
`export (Array, Texture) var my_texture_array`

If we could improve export to take in two arguments, one that tells it that we want to create an export of type Array, and the other to define the type, we would make it a lot more user-friendly and intuitive.

I am not saying it is not possible to create an array of Textures in the editor. Currently, if you were to write for example:
`export var my_array = Array()`
you would get an Array in the editor. 
...
Except it is very encumbersome.
You would have to first set the size of the array (and that is fine, but can also be improved by adding a + button), 
Then you would have to set the type; browsing through a long list of types. That can take a minute if you don't know exactly where in the list it is. 

So if I were to select for example "Object", I get a long list I have to look through in order to find "Texture". 
![](http://i.imgur.com/ockxTi7.png)
I would have to select ImageTexture, since Texture is not on the list. Did not know that, so I probably spend a lot more time trying to find it.
After all that, I can select the little arrow on the right in order to open ImageTexture in the inspector. This allows me to load ONE image. Now I have to repeat the same process for every. single. texture.

So my thought by adding an 
`export(Array, Texture) var my_textures` 
option to GDScript, we would not have to select any "Type", navigate a long long list, select it and open it up, and only to repeat this nonsense. 

It would just be there, ready and waiting for you. Easily accessible and user-friendly.

Thoughts? Opinions? Feelings?

data.title: UVs are unusable if VisualServer doesn't also get a texture
data.body:
I am trying to draw geometry in 2D using `VisualServer::get_singleton()->canvas_item_add_triangle_array`, however I noticed that UVs are unusable in a shader unless you also specify a texture. That can be annoying if all you have is a procedural material that doesn't need a main texture. The workaround is then to put a dummy texture RID as an argument.
Is this subject to change in 3.0?

data.title: Input actions don't update pressed states after OS window adjustment
data.body:
Operating system: Windows 8.1(64)
Godot version: Godot_v2.1.1-stable_win64
Issue description: 
Input actions don't update pressed states after OS window adjustment. This may create an input saying its pressed even though you released it outside of the game.

Steps to reproduce:
1.) press and hold an action
2.) adjust OS window and release action 

Video of me doing it:
[https://youtu.be/3bZuJVrmGJw](https://youtu.be/3bZuJVrmGJw)
